alert.note: Alert for Whatcom (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 28 at 3:22PM PST until January 29 at 3:27AM PST by NWS Seattle
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Washington... Nooksack River At North Cedarville affecting Whatcom County. .Heavy rain over the North Cascades overnight has brought significant rises on the Nooksack River, with flooding expected to continue through the afternoon and evening. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TONIGHT... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Nooksack River at North Cedarville. * WHEN...Until late tonight. * IMPACTS...At 146.5 feet, the Nooksack River will cause shallow flooding of low pasture lands along the river downstream through Lynden. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2:30 PM PST Sunday the stage was 146.8 feet. - Flood stage is 146.5 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 2:30 PM PST Sunday was 147.3 feet. - Forecast...The river has crested at 147.2 feet late this afternoon, and will fall below flood stage this evening down to 142.8 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 147.0 feet on 11/28/2014. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued by this evening at 1130 PM PST.
